trend_summary: Agriculture remains dominant; villages expand slowly around the river crossing while fields consolidate. Northern and riparian woodlands broaden, greening former plots. Infrastructure sees a new bridge/embankment but no major industry. Overall land-use stays largely rural with limited, scattered growth.
notable_changes: Gradual outward growth of the main riverside settlement with a few new housing clusters.
Small irregular fields merged into larger rectangular parcels, indicating farm consolidation.
Woodland cover increases, especially in the northern quadrant and along watercourses.
Construction or upgrade of a bridge/levee system visible from the third image onward.
Vegetated expansion onto former bare flood-plain areas, reducing exposed sandbars.
